channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PDFBOX-2508] Text extraction getting zero font height, bad widths, and ? for text in this PDF with Type 3 Fonts
item.description:
Attached file is just line one from a file where every piece of text has these problems. All the other lines were removed with Nitro to make a small test case.

This is the output from PrintTextLocations example:
String[211.92,356.8801 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=1.75392 space=190528.28 width=1.7052002]?
String[129.84,347.04 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=2.72832 space=288435.66 width=2.679596]?
String[70.32,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=7.0643997]?
String[77.3844,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=4.8720016]?
String[82.2564,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=6.333603]?
String[88.590004,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=6.577202]?
String[95.167206,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=6.0899963]?
String[101.2572,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=6.333603]?
String[107.590805,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=6.0899963]?
String[113.6808,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=4.8720016]?
String[118.5528,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=3.1668015]?
String[121.719604,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=6.333603]?
String[128.0532,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=6.577194]?
String[134.63042,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=6.0899963]?
String[140.72041,299.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=3.31296 space=349985.12 width=3.1667938]?
String[522.95984,293.28 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=1.36416 space=150394.36 width=1.4616089]?

Fontsize is way too big (should be more like 8), value for space is ridiculous, height is too small. And each character is coming through as a '?'. The original file has this on every piece of text.

In Acrobat everything looks fine, both in the original and in this test case.
item.summary: Text extraction getting zero font height, bad widths, and ? for text in this PDF with Type 3 Fonts

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
You definitively won't get any useful text from that file, Adobe can't either.
https://pdfbox.apache.org/userguide/faq.html#notext
https://pdfbox.apache.org/userguide/faq.html#gibberish

The value returned by PrintTextLocations#getFontSize() is the raw font size in the PDF, it's common for this to be scaled-down in the PDF content, perhaps you want #getFontSizeInPt() instead?

At one point I tried to fix some of the TextPosition calculations but it ended up breaking PDFTextStripper, which seems to rely on the "broken" values, so I didn't make the commit.

If you're interested in extracting each glyph but you don't need TextPosition instances, then you might want to try subclassing the new PDFStreamEngine in the 2.0 trunk, because it provides accurate callbacks for each glyph.

IMHO 1f / in this line in our code is wrong:

glyphSpaceToTextSpaceFactor = 1f / font.getFontMatrix().getScaleX();

This line was inserted 10 years ago and was originally meant for all fonts:
http://pdfbox.cvs.sourceforge.net/viewvc/pdfbox/pdfbox/src/org/pdfbox/util/PDFStreamEngine.java?r1=1.22&r2=1.23

The spec has this text:

A common practice is to define glyphs in terms of a 1000-unit glyph coordinate system, in which case the font matrix is [0.001 0 0 0.001 0 0].

With the file from PDFBOX-2794, 1 / 0.001 = 1000. And that is multiplied with the space width 277.832, so the base value is 277832! A Tf value of 8 means that the size is now 2222656.

Commit 1711701 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1711701 ]

PDFBOX-2508: correct calculation of glyphSpaceToTextSpaceFactor, remove misleading comment

Commit 1711714 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/branches/1.8'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1711714 ]

PDFBOX-2508: correct calculation of glyphSpaceToTextSpaceFactor, remove misleading comment

fred_andrews Your title mentions "zero font height", your output text in the issue doesn't have zero font height, and what I get after the fix is this:

String[211.92,356.8801 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=0.0 space=3.3609185 width=1.7052002]?
String[129.84,347.04 fs=58.0 xscale=58.0 height=0.0 space=5.0880046 width=2.679596]?

Did you use a modified version at that time? I tried with 1.8.7 (the version you mentioned) and I get zero height.

With 2.0, the output is:

Commit 1711758 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1711758 ]

PDFBOX-2508: fix bug in construction of font BoundingBox from PDRectangle

Commit 1711765 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/branches/1.8'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1711765 ]

PDFBOX-2508: get font height from FontBBox item if existing method fails

This resolves your issue. There might still be files with zero type 3 height, see PDFBOX-3076. And despite resolving, I'd like to hear how you got non-zero in your initial post.
jhirsh please retest your application as far as type 3 heights are concerned, because [ https://svn.apache.org/r1711758 ] will make all type 3 heights slightly smaller.

Commit 1722375 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1722375 ]

PDFBOX-3175, PDFBOX-2508, PDFBOX-3062: fix height calculations analog to rev 1711701, font matrix is to be used only for type3 fonts
